Defaults options

MDB Table Ediotr has a few default options which can be easy changed. For example there is a basic DataTable with custom styles.

Below this tables are tables with each editor and custom styles, you can ealiy do it for yourn own.

Defaults options are following :

Name Type Value Description
headerLength Number 6 Custom length of columns.
evenTextColor String #000 Table even rows text color
oddTextColor String #000 Table odd rows text color
bgEvenColor String '' Table even rows background color
bgOddColor String '' Table odd rows background color
thText String '' Table head/footer rows text color
thBg String '' Table head/footer rows background color
modalEditor Boolean false To enable modal editor change to true
rowEditor Boolean false To enable row editor change to true
bubbleEditor Boolean false To enable bubble editor change to true
contentEditor Boolean false To enable content editor change to true

MDB DataTable

Custom example. Check for more here.

Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary

MDB Modal Table Editor

This version of the Editor allows you to add, edit and remove rows by using a modal.

Select a row and click the "Edit" button if you want to make changes in the given row. "Delete" button works the same way.

For more explain see our documentation about editor.

0 row selected

Add new form

Edit form

Delete

Are you sure to delete selected row?

Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples
Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples

MDB Row Table Editor

This version of the Editor allows you to add, edit and remove rows by activating an edition mode.

All operations are carried out directly in a row.

For more explain see our documentation about editor.

Delete

Are you sure to delete selected rows?

Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples
Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples

MDB Content Table Editor

This example show you have to use content editor. It's very easy to use. You have 3 buttons and each buttons have own functions.

First button will active the editor and if you will have active input in table data after click that button with active td will be disabled until you click again on button or when you will use sorting option.

Second button will add new table row on the first DataTable page (always). If you will have inactive editor new table row will be disabled.

Third button will remove first table row on the first DataTable page (always) after click or if you will have selected table data with input field, that button will remove selected table data with whole table row.

Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples
Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples

MDB Bubble Table Editor

This example show you have to use content bubble editor. It's very easy to use. You have 3 buttons and each buttons have own functions.

First button will active a editor.

Second button will add new table row on the first DataTable page (always). If you will have inactive editor new table row will be disabled.

Third button will remove first table row on the first DataTable page (always) after click or if you will have selected table data with input field.

Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples
Name Position Office Extn. Start date Salary Examples
